job_title: Mental Health Clinician in San Mateo, CA
pros: Employees at StarVista are treated respectfully and the schedule is very flexible. Great place to balance home and work responsibility and life. Most clinical supervisors are well trained and really care about our community and clients.
cons: The usual cons with non-profit organizations: Modest salaries. They try to compensate with flexibility of time off and vacation time. Most of the employees at StarVista don't work there for the money, however, it's very difficult to live in the Bay Area with those salaries.

pros: Great team environment, motivated and passionate employees. Agency highly attentive to employee needs. Very low turnover OVERALL though specific programs may vary. Tends to prefer hiring from within.
cons: Nonprofit salaries. Pay not equitable across job duties and positions.

job_title: Mental Health Clinician in San Mateo, CA
pros: Great team, motivated, passionate colleagues. Program manager was understanding and flexible. Trainings offered. Good supervision. Decent case load without too much stress on clinicians.
cons: Some upper management seemed to be there for seniority even if they didn't serve the team well. Non-profit status made budgets unstable, not much job security.

pros: You get to work in a great environment helping youth and families reunify.
cons: There really aren't any cons unless you hate working in environments that are sometimes slow. (I.E., sometimes all the youth are gone, or there are days where there are no phone calls coming in and not too much to do around the house.)

pros: StarVista has an awesome work culture.  Everyone is super passionate about what they do.  They also attempt to do what they can to help the community.
cons: They are mostly government funded, so up-to-date technology (i.e. computers, computer software) will be lacking--something that most government funded agencies struggle with.

pros: Lots of opportunities for training and gaining experience with different populations. Good about promoting from within.
cons: Infrastructure getting outdated. This refers to databases used or other systems in place. This is a problem in the mental health field as a whole.

pros: Fantastic staff.  Couldn't ask for a more dedicated and humane place to work.  There is emphasis on employee care as well as client care.
cons: Pay is modest and there is a huge amount of staff turnover.
